result.execSummary:
The defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>10-50g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

CASE RECALLED.  Appearance of the defendant waived by defense.  

The court further orders that conditions of extended supervision to be determined/at the discretion of the Department of Corrections.

Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz; defendant in custody.
Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: DDS.

***Matter before the Court for RESENTENCING HEARING***

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by counsel and defendant.  Additional statement made by Jamette S.

COURT ADVISES the defendant that he is REQUIRED to provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, however if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute, and that he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.

COUNT 3:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 4 AND 5, CONSECUTIVE to 15CF000547 AND any other sentence with credit for 0 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 3 YEARS.

COUNT 4:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 3 AND 5, CONSECUTIVE to 15CF000547 AND any other sentence with credit for 0 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 3 YEARS.

COUNT 5:  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 12 YEARS, CONCURRENT TO COUNTS 3 AND 4, CONSECUTIVE to 15CF000547 AND any other sentence with credit for 0 days. 
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 7 YEARS.  The MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION IS 5 YEARS.

The defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  
  
The defendant shall pay all applicable mandatory costs and surcharges from prison funds, including wages and all other monies, in an amount or percentage the Department (DOC) determines to be reasonable and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant advised of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Count 5:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 15 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 10 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 5 years - consecutive to Count 3 & 4 and 15cf547; pay a fine of $5,000 plus mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) do not use or possess illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds;
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 8 years with 219 days credit - consecutive to 15cf547; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 5 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years; pay mandatory costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 4:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 6 years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 3 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 3 years - concurrent with with Count 3, but consecutive to 15cf547; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

CORRECTION AS TO PLEA DATE OF 7/2/2015.  
Entry should state:
Defendant Kentrell Deshawn Hughlett in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, & 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered COUNTS 1, 2, and 6 dismissed, and read in for sentencing. 

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, & 5:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, received and filed. 

Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Case adjourned for sentencing on 9/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 44.  Court orders PSI.  PSI order signed and filed.  aw

Court vacates trial date on 8/17/2015.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
